content: I wonder if there's a way to forward all Discord messages in #rustdoc to a topic named 'discord' or something. That way people (ahem, me) would not miss rustdoc-related messages because they were in Discord.
I think we should just close the rustdoc channel, it's been a few months. @GuillaumeGomez are you ok with that?

Camelid said:

I wonder if there's a way to forward all Discord messages in #rustdoc to a topic named 'discord' or something. That way people (ahem, me) would not miss rustdoc-related messages because they were in Discord.

forwarding is nice for Zulip users but doesn't help discord users much because they don't see other topics
Yeah, but I thought others might be opposed to closing the Discord channel :)
And it would at least be an improvement over the current situation.
I am, just sad about it and a bit afraid since we still have people coming through discord and not zulip
And I still find zulip awful.
And I find Discord awful :upside_down:
I find discord awful too XD
hmm I think @Nemo157 is the one who uses discord the most - would you prefer a zulip bridge?
should we go to matrix? I just created an account and it's working fine XD
@Camelid note that someone has to be on the hook for implementing it

GuillaumeGomez said:

should we go to matrix? I just created an account and it's working fine XD

Yeah, I used to use Matrix but it has all the downsides of Discord
oh right, maybe put the discord chan private to allow nemo to interact with us then?

Joshua Nelson said:

Camelid note that someone has to be on the hook for implementing it

Yeah, I thought maybe someone else might already know how to do it (like on T-infra)
you should ask that in #t-infra
what do you think about my suggestion?
at the very least, it'd make zulip the official way to contact us
I didn't fully understand it, could you explain a bit more?
until we add a bridge or whatever
Maybe we could start with forwarding/bridging if T-infra knows how and move fully to Discord if people agree?
simply making the rustdoc channel private on discord until we figure out the bridge thing
wait what?
aren't we doing the opposite like allowing discord messages to come here? XD
My proposal was forward Discord to Zulip.
Yours is make the rustdoc channel private?
Isn't that effectively the same as closing it?
Opened https://rust-lang.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/242791-t-infra/topic/forwarding.20Discord.20to.20Zulip btw.
No, I simply said to turn the discord channel private until the bridge thing is done
my proposition doesn't exclude yours haha
So essentially "close it to the public" until we get bridging set up and then re-open it?
I would imagine setting up bridging (if T-infra knows how) wouldn't take that long.
all this seems more complicated than it needs to be
I'm ambivalent to either forwarding or closing the channel, but I don't see much point in making it private
ok ok
Yeah, I still don't fully understand the turning it private thing
I thought you wanted to close it but still wanted to keep in touch with nemo?
Ah, does Nemo not use Zulip?
If T-infra think they can set up forwarding for us, that would at least be a good start. If not, we'll have to figure out what to do.

simulacrum said:

Not at this time, I don't think.
So unless someone else on T-infra knows how, looks like that's a dead end.

my .2 cents on the matter (that nobody asked ^^):

  • forwarding messages from Discord is IMO unpractical, I'm afraid we would receive a non-actionable "read-only" copy, more akin to a notification and only on a selected number of supported receivers. If I have to go back to Discord to reply, I feel like I've lost the advantage.
  • bridging messages between Zulip and Discord (example through a mega bridge) requires a T-infra effort which I'm not sure they have bandwidth for right now
  • side note: by reading around, Discord is becoming more and more hostile and little by little closing their API
  • the Matrix protocol (which I strongly support for some use cases) has a subpar threading model than Zulip, so I agree with Joshua Nelson here

I understand the problem here and I cringe when communities (even relatively small such as rustdoc) are split because proprietary platforms obtusely refuse to interoperate with open protocols.

forwarding messages from Discord is IMO unpractical, I'm afraid we would receive a non-actionable "read-only" copy, more akin to a notification and only on a selected number of supported receivers. If I have to go back to Discord to reply, I feel like I've lost the advantage.

To me, that's better than nothing. But it seems T-infra is not able to set it up at this point.
I would rather just archive the #rustdoc discord
That's why I suggested to switch the discord channel to private: if the goal is to make people go here for questions but to keep contact with nemo, it seems like a good in-between.
